newsitem.title: UK: LME prices steady in late trading after mixed day.
newsitem.headline: LME prices steady in late trading after mixed day.

text.p: Zinc and aluminium held onto their gains in uneventful late trading on Wednesday, while lacklustre copper edged just higher after a down day. Three months copper was last indicated at $2,277/2,280 per tonne at 1800 GMT, while the cash to threes backwardation was unchanged at $60/$65.
Copper had ended the afternoon kerb at $2,273, which was down $27 from Tuesday's finish.
Zinc meanwhile was barely changed at $1,550/1,554, versus $1,551, after rallying to fresh seven-year highs earlier in the day.
Aluminium, which posted strong gains on speculative and trade buying against a background of nearby tightness, was stable at $1,642/1,645 against $1,642.
